Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of the national coin shortage by stating that it is the "beginning of the end of paper money" and part of a "decades-old plan" towards a one-world government.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that the national coin shortage was done intentionally or as part of a larger plan.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the national coin shortage is a deliberate action by the Mint to phase out paper money, without providing any substantial evidence for this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert's verdict provides an alternative explanation for the national coin shortage, attributing it to the disruption caused by the COVID-19 pandemic and the resulting decline in coin circulation.
